quote: Whenever dharma declines and the purpose of life is forgotten, I manifest myself on earth. I am born in every age to protect the good, to destroy evil, and to reestablish dharma.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: As they approach me, so I receive them. All paths, Arjuna, lead to me.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: I am the beginning, middle, and end of creation.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Among animals I am the lion; among birds, the eagle Garuda. I am Prahlada, born among the demons, and of all that measures, I am time.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: I am death, which overcomes all, and the source of all beings still to be born.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Just remember that I am, and that I support the entire cosmos with only a fragment of my being.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Behold, Arjuna, a million divine forms, with an infinite variety of color and shape. Behold the gods of the natural world, and many more wonders never revealed before. Behold the entire cosmos turning within my body, and the other things you desire to see.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: I am time, the destroyer of all; I have come to consume the world.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: That one is dear to me who runs not after the pleasant or away from the painful, grieves not, lusts not, but lets things come and go as they happen.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Just as a reservoir is of little use when the whole countryside is flooded, scriptures are of little use to the illumined man or woman, who sees the Lord everywhere.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: They alone see truly who see the Lord the same in every creature, who see the deathless in the hearts of all that die. Seeing the same Lord everywhere, they do not harm themselves or others. Thus they attain the supreme goal.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: With a drop of my energy I enter the earth and support all creatures. Through the moon, the vessel of life-giving fluid, I nourish all plants. I enter breathing creatures and dwell within as the life-giving breath. I am the fire in the stomach which digests all food.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: There are three gates to this self-destructive hell: lust, anger, and greed. Renounce these three.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Pleasure from the senses seems like nectar at first, but it is bitter as poison in the end.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: That which seems like poison at first, but tastes like nectar in the end - this is the joy of sattva, born of a mind at peace with itself.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: The Lord dwells in the hearts of all creatures and whirls them round upon the wheel of maya. Run to him for refuge with all your strength, and peace profound will be yours through his grace.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Whatever you do, make it an offering to me - the food you eat, the sacrifices you make, the help you give, even your suffering.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: I am heat; I give and withhold the rain. I am immortality and I am death; I am what is and what is not.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Those who worship other gods with faith and devotion also worship me, Arjuna, even if they do not observe the usual forms. I am the object of all worship, its enjoyer and Lord.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Those who remember me at the time of death will come to me. Do not doubt this. Whatever occupies the mind at the time of death determines the destination of the dying; always they will tend toward that state of being.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: When meditation is mastered, the mind is unwavering like the flame of a lamp in a windless place.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: They are forever free who renounce all selfish desires and break away from the egocage of 'I', 'me', and 'mine' to be united with the Lord. This is the supreme state. Attain to this, and pass from death to immortality.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: They live in wisdom who see themselves in all and all in them, who have renounced every selfish desire and sense-craving tormenting the heart.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: The meaning of Karma is in the intention. The intention behind action is what matters. Those who are motivated only by desire for the fruits of action are miserable, for they are constantly anxious about the results of what they do.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: You have the right to work, but never to the fruit of work. You should never engage in action for the sake of reward, nor should you long for inaction.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Perform work in this world, Arjuna, as a man established within himself - without selfish attachments, and alike in success and defeat. For yoga is perfect evenness of mind.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: At the beginning of time I declared two paths for the pure heart: jnana yoga, the contemplative path of spiritual wisdom, and karma yoga, the active path of selfless service. There are the fundamental different types of yoga.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Do your work with the welfare of others always in mind. It was by such work that Janaka attained perfection; others too have followed this path.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: There is nothing in the three worlds for me to gain, Arjuna, nor is there anything I do not have; I continue to act, but I am not driven by any need of my own.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: The ignorant work for their own profit, Arjuna; the wise work for the welfare of the world, without thought for themselves.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: It is better to strive in one's own dharma than to succeed in the dharma of another. Nothing is ever lost in following one's own dharma, but competition in another's dharma breeds fear and insecurity.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: The senses are higher than the body, the mind higher than the senses; above the mind is the intellect, and above the intellect is the Atman. Thus, knowing that which is supreme, let the Atman rule the ego. Use your mighty arms to slay the fierce enemy that is selfish desire.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: You and I have passed through many births, Arjuna. You have forgotten, but I remember them all.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: My true being is unborn and changeless. I am the Lord who dwells in every creature. Through the power of my own maya, I manifest myself in a finite form.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Those who know me as their own divine Self break through the belief that they are the body and are not reborn as separate creatures. Such a one, Arjuna, is united with me.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Delivered from selfish attachment, fear, and anger, filled with me, surrendering themselves to me, purified in the fire of my being, many have reached the state of unity in me.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Actions do not cling to me because I am not attached to their results. Those who understand this and practice it live in freedom.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: The wise see that there is action in the midst of inaction and inaction in the midst of action. Their consciousness is unified, and every act is done with complete awareness.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: The process of offering is Brahman; that which is offered is Brahman. Brahman offers the sacrifice in the fire of Brahman. Brahman is attained by those who see Brahman in every action.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: The offering of wisdom is better than any material offering, Arjuna; for the goal of all work is spiritual wisdom.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Approach those who have realized the purpose of life and question them with reverence and devotion; they will instruct you in this wisdom.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Even if you were the most sinful of sinners, Arjuna, you could cross beyond all sin by the raft of spiritual wisdom.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Krishna delivers the Gita to Arjuna.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: As the heat of a fire reduces wood to ashes, the fire of knowledge burns to ashes all karma.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Those who surrender to Brahman all selfish attachments are like the leaf of a lotus floating clean and dry in water. Sin cannot touch them.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Those who renounce attachment in all their deeds live content in the 'city of nine gates', the body, as its master. They are not driven to act, nor do they involve others in action.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Those who possess this wisdom have equal regard for all. They see the same Self in a spiritual aspirant and an outcaste, in an elephant, a cow, and a dog.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Pleasures conceived in the world of the senses have a beginning and an end and give birth to misery, Arjuna. The wise do not look for happiness in them. But those who overcome the impulses of lust and anger which arise in the body are made whole and live in joy. They find their joy, their rest, and their light completely within themselves. United with the Lord, they attain nirvana in Brahman.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Free from anger and selfish desire, unified in mind, those who follow the path of yoga and realize the Self are established forever in that supreme state.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Knowing me as the friend of all creatures, the Lord of the universe, the end of all offerings and all spiritual disciplines, they attain eternal peace.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: It is not those who lack energy or refrain from action, but those who work without expectation of reward who attain the goal of meditation.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Those who cannot renounce attachment to the results of their work are far from the path.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Reshape yourself through the power of your will; never let yourself be degraded by self-will. The will is the only friend of the Self, and the will is the only enemy of the Self.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: To those who have conquered themselves, the will is a friend. But it is the enemy of those who have not found the Self within them.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: The supreme Reality stands revealed in the consciousness of those who have conquered themselves. They live in peace, alike in cold and heat, pleasure and pain, praise and blame.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: With all fears dissolved in the peace of the Self and all actions dedicated to Brahman, controlling the mind and fixing it on me, sit in meditation with me as your only goal.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Arjuna, those who eat too much or eat too little, who sleep too much or sleep too little, will not succeed in meditation. But those who are temperate in eating and sleeping, work and recreation, will come to the end of sorrow through meditation.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: In the still mind, in the depths of meditation, the Self reveals itself. Beholding the Self by means of the Self, an aspirant knows the joy and peace of complete fulfillment.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Wherever the mind wanders, restless and diffuse in its search for satisfaction without, lead it within; train it to rest in the Self.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: I am ever present to those who have realized me in every creature. Seeing all life as my manifestation, they are never separated from me.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: When a person responds to the joys and sorrows of others as if they were his own, he has attained the highest state of spiritual union.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: No one who does good work will ever come to a bad end, either here or in the world to come.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Through constant effort over many lifetimes, a person becomes purified of all selfish desires and attains the supreme goal of life.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Meditation is superior to severe asceticism and the path of knowledge. It is also superior to selfless service. May you attain the goal of meditation, Arjuna!.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Even among those who meditate, that man or woman who worships me with perfect faith, completely absorbed in me, is the most firmly established in yoga.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: With your mind intent on me, Arjuna, discipline yourself with the practice of yoga. Depend on me completely. Listen, and I will dispel all your doubts; you will come to know me fully and be united with me.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: The birth and dissolution of the cosmos itself take place in me. There is nothing that exists separate from me, Arjuna. The entire universe is suspended from me as my necklace of jewels.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Arjuna, I am the taste of pure water and the radiance of the sun and moon. I am the sacred word and the sound heard in air, and the courage of human beings. I am the sweet fragrance in the earth and the radiance of fire; I am the life in every creature and the striving of the spiritual aspirant.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: My eternal seed, Arjuna, is to be found in every creature. I am the power of discrimination in those who are intelligent, and the glory of the noble. In those who are strong, I am strength, free from passion and selfish attachment. I am desire itself, if that desire is in harmony with the purpose of life.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: The states of sattva, rajas, and tamas come from me, but I am not in them.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: The three gunas make up my divine maya, difficult to overcome. But they cross over this maya who take refuge in me.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Some come to the spiritual life because of suffering, some in order to understand life; some come through a desire to achieve life's purpose, and some come who are men and women of wisdom. Unwavering in devotion, always united with me, the man or woman of wisdom surpasses all the others.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: After many births the wise seek refuge in me, seeing me everywhere and in everything. Such great souls are very rare.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: The world, deluded, does not know that I am without birth and changeless. I know everything about the past, the present, and the future, Arjuna; but there is no one who knows me completely.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Delusion arises from the duality of attraction and aversion, Arjuna; every creature is deluded by these from birth.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Those who see me ruling the cosmos, who see me in the adhibhuta, the adhidaiva, and the adhiyajna, are conscious of me even at the time of death.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: The Lord is the supreme poet, the first cause, the sovereign ruler, subtler than the tiniest particle, the support of all, inconceivable, bright as the sun, beyond darkness.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Remembering me at the time of death, close down the doors of the senses and place the mind in the heart. Then, while absorbed in meditation, focus all energy upwards to the head. Repeating in this state the divine name, the syllable Om that represents the changeless Brahman, you will go forth from the body and attain the supreme goal.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: I am easily attained by the person who always remembers me and is attached to nothing else. Such a person is a true yogi, Arjuna.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Every creature in the universe is subject to rebirth, Arjuna, except the one who is united with me.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: The six months of the northern path of the sun, the path of light, of fire, of day, of the bright fortnight, leads knowers of Brahman to the supreme goal. The six months of the southern path of the sun, the path of smoke, of night, of the dark fortnight, leads other souls to the light of the moon and to rebirth.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Under my watchful eye the laws of nature take their course. Thus is the world set in motion; thus the animate and the inanimate are created.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: I am the ritual and the sacrifice; I am true medicine and the mantram. I am the offering and the fire which consumes it, and the one to whom it is offered.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: I am the father and mother of this universe, and its grandfather too; I am its entire support. I am the sum of all knowledge, the purifier, the syllable Om; I am the sacred scriptures, the Rig, Yajur, and Sama Vedas.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: I am the goal of life, the Lord and support of all, the inner witness, the abode of all. I am the only refuge, the one true friend; I am the beginning, the staying, and the end of creation; I am the womb and the eternal seed.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Those who follow the rituals given in the Vedas, who offer sacrifices and take soma, free themselves from evil and attain the vast heaven of the gods, where they enjoy celestial pleasures. When they have enjoyed these fully, their merit is exhausted and they return to this land of death. Thus observing Vedic rituals but caught in an endless chain of desires, they come and go.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Those who worship me and meditate on me constantly, without any other thought - I will provide for all their needs.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Those who worship the devas will go to the realm of the devas; those who worship their ancestors will be united with them after death. Those who worship phantoms will become phantoms; but my devotees will come to me.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Fill your mind with me; love me; serve me; worship me always. Seeking me in your heart, you will at last be united with me.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: All the scriptures lead to me; I am their author and their wisdom.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Bhishma, Drona, Jayadratha, Karna, and many others are already slain. Kill those whom I have killed. Do not hesitate. Fight in this battle and you will conquer your enemies.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Not by knowledge of the Vedas, nor sacrifice, nor charity, nor rituals, nor even by severe asceticism has any other mortal seen what you have seen, O heroic Arjuna.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Better indeed is knowledge than mechanical practice. Better than knowledge is meditation. But better still is surrender of attachment to results, because there follows immediate peace.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Some realize the Self within them through the practice of meditation, some by the path of wisdom, and others by selfless service. Others may not know these paths; but hearing and following the instructions of an illumined teacher, they too go beyond death.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: The brightness of the sun, which lights up the world, the brightness of the moon and of fire - these are my glory.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Calmness, gentleness, silence, self-restraint, and purity: these are the disciplines of the mind.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: To refrain from selfish acts is one kind of renunciation, called sannyasa; to renounce the fruit of action is another, called tyaga.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: By serving me with steadfast love, a man or woman goes beyond the gunas. Such a one is fit for union with Brahman.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: When they see the variety of creation rooted in that unity and growing out of it, they attain fulfillment in Brahman.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: I have shared this profound truth with you, Arjuna. Those who understand it will attain wisdom; they will have done that which has to be done.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: I give you these precious words of wisdom; reflect on them and then do as you choose.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Fearlessness is the first requisite of spirituality. Cowards can never be moral.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: You do not like to suffer yourself. How can you inflict suffering on others? Every killing is a suicide. The eternal, blissful and natural state has been smothered by this life of ignorance. In this way the present life is due to killing of the eternal, pristine Being. Is it not a case of suicide?
author: Ramana Maharishi

quote: To be free from violence is the duty of every man. No thought of revenge, hatred or ill will should arise in our minds. Injuring others gives rise to hatred.
author: Swami Shivananda

quote: O lover of meditation, become pure and clean. Observe non-violence in mind, speech and body. Never break another’s heart. Avoid wounding another’s feelings. Harm no one. Help all. Neither be afraid nor frighten others.
author: Swami Muktananda

quote: Someone who believes in violence and continues causing injury to others can never be peaceful himself.
author: Swami Satchidananda

quote: Refrain from killing knowingly even the trifling insects like a louse, a bug or a mosquito. Use no violence even to gain possession of a woman, wealth or kingdom. Never kill any animals even for the purpose of sacrifice. Non-violence is the greatest of all religions.
author: Swami Sahajanand

quote: Strictly speaking, no activity and no industry is possible without a certain amount of violence, no matter how little. Even the very process of living is impossible without a certain amount of violence. What we have to do is to minimize it to the greatest extent possible.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: The test of ahimsa is the absence of jealousy. The man whose heart never cherishes even the thought of injury to anyone, who rejoices at the prosperity of even his greatest enemy, that man is the bhakta, he is the yogi, he is the guru of all.
author: Swami Vivekananda

quote: If you plant eggplant, you can pluck eggplants. If you sow goodness, you can reap goodness. If you sow evil you will reap evil. Do good to all. God is there, within you. Don’t kill. Don’t harbour anger.
author: Shiva Yogaswami

quote: By ‘ahimsa’ Patanjali meant the removal of the desire to kill. All forms of life have an equal right to the air of maya. All men may understand this truth by overcoming the passion of destruction.
author: Shri Yukteshwar

quote: The Hindu sage sees the whole of life. If he does not fight, it is not because he rejects all fighting as futile, but because he has finished his fights. He has overcome all dissensions between himself and the world and is now at rest.
author: Dr. S Radhakrishnan

quote: The Supreme Brahman is characterised by truth, knowledge and bliss (sat-chit-ananda), and that is the only reality. The universe is perceived to be real, because it is superimposed upon brahman, just as blue colour is superimposed upon the sky. Whatever is negated by means of proof must be unreal. But that which is not so disproved must be real, if it is true at all times. The animate and the inanimate prove the existence of brahman. When one says, 'I do not know brahman', even that should be taken as proof of its existence.
author: Adi Shankaracharya

quote: The Supreme Person is unsurpassed, and infinite joy in himself. He becomes the joy of another also, as his nature of joy is absolute and universal. When Brahman becomes the object of one’s contemplation, he (the meditator) becomes blissful. Thus, the supreme Brahman is the ocean of infinite and unsurpassed excellence of attributes. He transcends all evil. The expanse of his glory is boundless. He abounds in surpassing condescension, maternal compassion, and supreme beauty. He is the principal entity. The individual self is subservient to him. If the seeker meditates on the Supreme with a full consciousness of this relationship and if the supreme Brahman so meditated upon becomes an object of supreme love to the devotee, then he himself effectuates the devotee’s god-realization.
author: Ramanujacharya

quote: The firm and unshakable love of God that rises above all ties of love and affection based upon an adequate knowledge and conviction of this great majesty is called bhakti (devotion). That alone is the means to moksha (liberation).
author: Madhvacharya

quote: Don’t try to see God, but act in such a way that God will want to see you.
author: Bhaktisiddhanta Sarasvati

quote: He success of one’s actions rests equally on destiny and personal effort. Destiny is the fruit of efforts made in a previous life. A chariot cannot move on one wheel alone, so without personal effort destiny alone accomplishes nothing.
author: Sage Yajnavalkya

quote: As one and the same water is called by different names by different people, some calling it ‘water,’ some ‘vari,’ some ‘acqua’, and some ‘pani’, so the one Sachidananda – Existence-Bliss-Absolute -is invoked by some as God, by some as Allah, by some as Hari and by others as Brahman. In a potter’s shop there are vessels of different shapes and forms – pots, jars, dishes, plates etc. – but all made of the same clay. So God is one, but worshipped in different ages and climes under different names and forms.
author: Shri Ramakrishna

quote: To say that there is no God is like saying 'I have no tongue'.
author: Amritanandamayi Devi

quote: We should always remember that everyone is responsible for his own life.
author: Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada

quote: In our country, there is a peculiar method of trapping monkeys. This process consists of bringing a big pot with a small mouth and keeping some material that is attractive to the monkey inside the pot. The monkey will put its hand inside the pot and catch hold of a handful of the material. It will then not be able to pull out its hand from within the pot. It will imagine that someone inside the pot is holding its hand. Then it makes an attempt to run away along with the pot, but the monkey is thus trapped. No one is holding the monkey. The monkey has trapped itself, because it has taken in its hand such a lot of material. The moment it lets the material in its hand go, it will be free.
author: Satya Sai Baba

quote: This Divine Being, Sachidananda, is at once impersonal and personal: it is an Existence and the origin and foundation of all truths, forces, powers, existences, but is also the one transcendent Conscious Being and the All-Person of whom all conscious beings are the selves and personalities; for he is their highest Self and the universal indwelling Presence. It is a necessity for the soul in the universe to know to grow into this truth of itself, to become one with the Divine Being, to raise its nature to the Divine Nature, its existence to the Divine Existence, its consciousness into the Divine Consciousness, its delight of being into the Divine Light of being.
author: Shri Aurobindo

quote: The All-Loving Father, the Great Lord, does not force his presence on the soul not yet ripe to receive him. With infinite patience, he waits and watches the struggle of the soul in samsara since the struggle is necessary for the full development of the faculties of the soul.
author: Lokacharya Pillai

quote: Religion teaches only good. Quarrels and fights are caused by man’s own selfish ego. Religion does not teach how to fragment or divide. The quarrels are not between religions but between politicians.
author: Pramukh Swami

quote: A man’s heart is always good at the core. It may get rusted on the outside on account of various internal factors but its goodness remains always the same, whatever the outward appearance. It is like the head of a cabbage whose outer layer may be bad but the inside layers retain their freshness.
author: Vinoba Bhave

quote: After every happiness comes misery; they may be far apart or near. The more advanced the soul, the more quickly does one follow the other. What we want is neither happiness nor misery. Both make us forget our true nature; both are chains, one iron, another gold; behind both is the Atman, who knows neither happiness nor misery. These are states and states must ever change; but the nature of the soul is bliss, peace, unchanging. We have not to get it, we have it; only wash away the dross and see it.
author: Swami Vivekananda

quote: The path of true non-violence requires much more courage than violence.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: When individuals change for the better, then society will change, and when society changes, then the country will change.
author: Pramukh Swami

quote: Remember that death is awaiting you at every moment
author: Swami Shivananda

quote: By filling a reservoir, you supply water to all the pipes connected to it. If you pour water at the root of a tree, it will reach all the branches. In the same way, by loving God, we love everyone. It is the same God dwelling within everyone.
author: Amritanandamayi Devi

quote: You are not this body; you are not this mind. You are the spirit. This is the greatest truth.
author: Shri Nirmila Devi

quote: Although almost every one of us can speak wonderfully on spiritual matters, when it comes to action and the living of a spiritual life, we find ourselves awfully deficient. To quicken the spirit, the impulse must come from another soul. The person from whose soul such an impulse comes is called the guru.
author: Swami Vivekananda

quote: To a worldly man, a God-intoxicated person will appear to be mad and he will laugh at him for it. But, to the God-intoxicated man, the worldly appear insane, foolish, misled, blind. Of all the insanities that harass man, God-madness is the least harmful, the most beneficial.
author: Satya Sai Baba

quote: Your basic nature, believe me, abhors this dull, dreary routine of eating drinking and sleeping. It seeks something which it knows it has lost santhi, inward contentment. It seeks liberation from bondage to the trivial and the temporary. Everyone craves for it in his heart of hearts.
author: Satya Sai Baba

quote: If you are working for Krishna, then its Krishna’s desire it you be successful or not. That means don’t think that because you are Krishna conscious, you will always be successful. No. It doesn’t matter – even if you are unsuccessful, you must know it firmly that without Krishna’s desire nothing can happen.
author: Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada

quote: Man’s history is the history of his journey to the unknown in quest of the realisation of his immortal self – his soul.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: An eye for an eye will only make the whole world blind.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: What use a bowman’s arrow or a poet’s words, if they enter the heart but do not cause the head to spin?
author: Rupa Goswami

quote: There is only one reason or secret [of success], the singular goal of earning the spiritual master’s pleasure. If he is pleased then we progress. If he is not pleased there is no trace of progress.
author: Pramukh Swami

quote: We don’t have a large number of followers. As soon as you try to sell a diamond, you cannot expect many customers. Nonetheless, a diamond is a diamond, even if there are no customers. The number of customers is not the test.
author: Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada

quote: The demythicisation and desacralisation of our society have accelerated by the liberal application of that peculiarly modern fancy that progress must be linear. This posture, which assumes the new to be always superior to the old, grows logically out of the western preference for linear thought. The doctrine of linear progress forbids ancient wisdom to enter into modernity, mandating that new and different reality forms must inevitably supplant and replace all older models. From the superficial standpoint, this is often true, for myths continually evolve new ways to express their messages, ways that are fit for the new conditions in which these myths are continually finding themselves. But myths do not jettison their old messages in order to load new ones (as, for instance, ‘liberation theologians’ have been trying to bend Christian myth into doing): instead, living myths develop new ways of transmitting the same eternal message.
author: Dr. Robert Svoboda

quote: Western culture gives freedom to the individual, regardless of the hurts he may cause to elders, spouse and children. Eastern culture gives freedom within the bounds of duty to elders, spouse and children. The sense of duty is the foundation of Hindu culture, and in performing duty one finds freedom from within oneself through the highest accomplishment of yoga.
author: Shivaya Subramaniyaswami

quote: Most humbly we bow to You, O Supreme Lord. At Your command moves the mighty wheel of time. You are eternal, and beyond eternity.
author: Atharva Veda

quote: The one who loves all intensely begins perceiving in all living beings a part of himself. He becomes a lover of all, a part and parcel of the Universal Joy. He flows with the stream of happiness, and is enriched by each soul.
author: Yajur Veda

quote: The human body is the temple of God. One who kindles the light of awareness within gets true light. The sacred flame of your inner shrine is constantly bright. The experience of unity is the fulfillment of human endeavors. The mysteries of life are revealed.
author: Rig Veda

quote: Sing the song of celestial love, O singer! May the divine fountain of eternal grace and joy enter your soul. May Brahma, (the Divine One), Pluck the strings of your inner soul with His celestial fingers, And feel His own presence within. Bless us with a divine voice That we may tune the harp-strings of our life To sing songs of Love to you.
author: Rig Veda

quote: Of everything he is the inmost Self. He is the truth; he is the Self supreme.
author: Chandogya Upanishad

quote: Meditating on the lotus of your heart, in the center is the untainted; the exquisitely pure, clear, and sorrowless; the inconceivable; the unmanifest, of infinite form; blissful, tranquil, immortal; the womb of Brahma.
author: Kaivalyopanishad

quote: Those in whose hearts OM reverberates Unceasingly are indeed blessed And deeply loved as one who is the Self. The all-knowing Self was never born, Nor will it die. Beyond cause and effect, This Self is eternal and immutable. When the body dies, the Self does not die.
author: Katha Upanishad

quote: The whole mantram AUM Indivisible, interdependent, Goes on reverberating in the mind. Established in this cosmic vibration, The sage goes beyond fear, decay, and death To enter into infinite peace.
author: Prashna Upanishad

quote: O Almighty! You are the infinite; the universe is also infinite! From infinite the infinite has come out! Having taken infinite out of the infinite, the infinite remains! O Almighty! May there be Peace! Peace! Everywhere!
author: Ishawashya Upanishad

quote: O seeker, know the true nature of your soul, and identify yourself with it completely. O Lord, (may we attain) the everlasting consciousness of Supreme Light and Joy. May we resolve to dedicate our life to the service of humankind, and uplift them to Divinity.
author: Yajur Veda

quote: O Brahma, lead us from the unreal to the real. O Brahma, lead us from darkness to light. O Brahma, lead us from death to immortality. Shanti, Shanti, Shanti, Om.
author: Brhadaranyaka Upanishad

quote: Look to this day, for it is life, the very breath of life. In its brief course lie all the realities of your existence; the bliss of growth, the glory of action, the splendor of beauty. For yesterday is only a dream, and tomorrow is but a vision. But today, well lived, makes every yesterday a dream of happiness, and every tomorrow a vision of hope. Look well, therefore, to this day.
author: Ancient Sanskrit

quote: The highest Self, all endless bliss, the unconditioned limitless consciousness, being realized, whether through the great texts, or through Yoga, in all experience whatever—let one lose himself in the ecstasy of Realization, for he has forever lost all touch with bondage of every description.
author: Svarajyasiddhi

quote: A particle of Its bliss supplies the bliss of the whole universe. Everything becomes enlightened in Its light. All else appears worthless after a sight of that essence. I am indeed of this Supreme Eternal Self.
author: Vijnanananka

quote: The knower catches in the ecstasy of his heart the full light of that Brahman (that Divine Essence) which is indescribable—all pure bliss, incomparable, transcending time, ever free, beyond desire.
author: Vivekachudamani

quote: Bright but hidden, the Self dwells in the heart. Everything that moves, breathes, opens, and closes Lives in the Self. He is the source of love And may be known through love but not through thought He is the goal of life. Attain this goal!
author: Mundaka Upanishad

quote: All is change in the world of the senses, But changeless is the supreme Lord of Love. Meditate on him, be absorbed by him, Wake up from this dream of separateness.
author: Shvetashvatara Upanishad

quote: Tat Tvam Asi: 'You are Divine'
author: Chandogya Upanishad

quote: Even as water becomes one with water, fire with fire, and air with air, the mind becomes one with the Infinite Mind and thus attains final freedom.
author: Maitri Upanishad

quote: Even as the sun shines and fills all space With light, above, below, across, so shines The Lord of Love and fills the hearts of all created beings.
author: Shvetashvatara Upanishad

quote: You are what your deep, driving desire is. As your desire is, so is your will. As your will is, so is your deed. As your deed is, so is your destiny.
author: Brihadaranyaka Upanishad

quote: Beyond the senses are the objects, beyond the objects is the mind, beyond the mind, is the intellect, and beyond the intellect is the great Atman.
author: Katha Upanishad

quote: Lead me from the unreal to the real Lead me from darkness to light Lead me from death to immortality.
author: Brihad-Aranyaka Upanishad

quote: The mind is said to be twofold, The pure and also the impure, Impure by union with desire, Pure, from desire completely free.
author: Maitri Upanishad

quote: God is all in all. He is action, knowledge, and goodness supreme. To know him, hidden in the lotus of the heart, is to untie the knot of ignorance.
author: Shvetashvatara Upanishad

quote: Behold the glory of God in the universe and all that lives and moves on earth. Leaving the transient, find joy in the Eternal.
author: Isha Upanishad

quote: That which cannot be apprehended by the mind, but by which, they say, the mind is apprehended. That alone know as Brahman and not that which people here worship.
author: Kena Upanishad

quote: That immortal Brahman alone is before, that Brahman is behind, that Brahman is to the right and left. Brahman alone pervades everything above and below; this universe is that supreme Brahman alone.
author: Mundaka Upanishad

quote: This syllable Om is indeed Brahman. This syllable is the highest. Whosoever knows this syllable obtains all that he desires.
author: Katha Upanishad

quote: Om is the bow; the Atman is the arrow; Brahman is said to be the mark. It is to be struck by an undistracted mind. Then the Atman becomes one with Brahman, as the arrow with the target.
author: Mundaka Upanishad

quote: The knowing Self is not born; it does not die. It has not sprung from anything; nothing has sprung from it. Birthless, eternal, everlasting and ancient, it is not killed when the body is killed.
author: Katha Upanishad

quote: The wise man beholds all beings in the Self and the Self in all beings; for that reason he does not hate anyone.
author: Isa Upanishad

quote: It is indeed the mind that is the cause of men’s bondage and liberation. The mind that is attached to sense-objects leads to bondage, while dissociated from sense-objects it tends to lead to liberation.
author: Amrita-Bindu Upanishad

quote: The Self that is subtler than the subtle and greater than the great is seated in the heart of every creature. One who is free from desire sees the glory of the Self through the tranquillity of the mind and senses and becomes absolved from grief.
author: Katha Upanishad

quote: This Atman, resplendent and pure, whom the sinless sannyasins behold residing within the body, is attained by unceasing practice of truthfulness, austerity, right knowledge and continence.
author: Mundaka Upanishad

quote: To the seer, all things have verily become the Self: what delusion, what sorrow, can there be for him who beholds that oneness?
author: Isa Upanishad

quote: Dissolve the Self in the supreme Self as the pot-space is dissolved in infinite space; then, as the Infinite be silent for ever, O sage!
author: Adhyatma Upanishad

quote: Knowing that great and all-pervading Self by which one sees (the objects) both in the sleep and the waking states, the intelligent man grieves no more.
author: Katha Upanishad

quote: Fools, dwelling in darkness, but wise in their own conceit and puffed up with vain scholarship, wander about, being afflicted by many ills, like blind men led by the blind.
author: Mundaka Upanishad

quote: Liberated from the grip of egoism, like the moon (after the eclipse), full, ever blissful, self-luminous, one attains one’s essence.
author: Adhyatma Upanishad

quote: He who perceives all beings in the Self alone, and the Self in all beings, does not entertain any hatred on account of that perception.
author: Isavasya Upanishad

quote: That which is consciousness alone which is all-pervading, which is eternal, which is all-full, which is of the form of bliss and which is indestructible, is the only true Brahman (infinite consciousness).
author: Varaha Upanishad

quote: Whether the body perishes now or lasts the age of moon and stars, what matters it to me having consciousness alone as my body? What matters it to the sky in the pot, whether it (the pot) is destroyed now or exists for a long time.
author: Varaha Upanishad

quote: Bondage is the imagination prompted by the desire for the eight powers.
author: Niralamba Upanishad

quote: Man is bound by ‘mine’, but he is released by ‘not mine’. He should abandon all the thoughts relating to externals and so also with references to internals. O Ribhu, having given up all thoughts, you should rest content (in your soul) ever.
author: Varaha Upanishad

quote: Like the butter hidden in milk, the pure consciousness resides in every being. That ought to be constantly churned out by the churning rod of the mind.
author: Amrita-Bindu Upanishad

quote: Being first in a state of changelessness and then thoroughly forgetting (even) that state owing to the cognition of the (true) nature of Brahman (infinite consciousness) – this is called samadhi.
author: Tejo-Bindu Upanishad

quote: In order to realize the Self, renounce everything. Having cast off all (objects), assimilate yourself to that which remains.
author: Annapurna Upanishad

quote: When all longings that are in the heart vanish, then a mortal becomes immortal and attains Brahman (infinite consciousness) here.
author: Katha Upanishad

quote: Those who are clever in arguments about Brahman, but are without the action pertaining to Brahman (infinite consciousness) and who are greatly attached to the world – those certainly are born again and again (in this world) through their ajnana (ignorance).
author: Tejo-Bindu Upanishad

quote: As rivers, flowing down, become indistinguishable on reaching the sea by giving up their names and forms, so also the illumined soul, having become freed from name and form, reaches the self-effulgent supreme Self.
author: Mundaka Upanishad

quote: Arise! Awake! Approach the great and learn. Like the sharp edge of a razor is that path, so the wise say—hard to tread and difficult to cross.
author: Katha Upanishad

quote: That which cannot be expressed by speech, but by which speech is expressed. That alone know as Brahman and not that which people here worship.
author: Kena Upanishad

quote: That which cannot be apprehended by the mind, but by which, they say, the mind is apprehended. That alone know as Brahman and not that which people here worship.
author: Kena Upanishad

quote: That which cannot be perceived by the eye, but by which the eye is perceived. That alone know as Brahman and not that which people here worship.
author: Kena Upanishad

quote: That which cannot be heard by the ear, but by which the hearing is perceived. That alone know as Brahman and not that which people here worship.
author: Kena Upanishad

quote: Children, immersed in ignorance in various ways, flatter themselves, saying: we have accomplished life’s purpose. Because these performers of karma do not know the truth owing to their attachment, they fall from heaven, misery—stricken, when the fruit of their work is exhausted.
author: Mundaka Upanishad

quote: As flowing rivers disappear in the sea, losing their names and forms, so a wise man, freed from name and form, attains the Purusha, who is greater than the great.
author: Mundaka Upanishad

quote: This syllable Om is indeed Brahman. This syllable is the highest. Whosoever knows this syllable obtains all that he desires.
author: Katha Upanishad

quote: Om is the bow; the Atman is the arrow; Brahman is said to be the mark. It is to be struck by an undistracted mind. Then the Atman becomes one with Brahman, as the arrow with the target.
author: Mundaka Upanishad

quote: The knowing self is not born; it does not die. It has not sprung from anything; nothing has sprung from it. Birthless, eternal, everlasting and ancient, it is not killed when the body is killed.
author: Katha Upanishad

quote: It is indeed the mind that is the cause of men’s bondage and liberation. The mind that is attached to sense-objects leads to bondage, while dissociated from sense-objects it tends to lead to liberation.
author: Amrita-bindu Upanishad

quote: The wise man beholds all beings in the self and the self in all beings; for that reason, he does not hate anyone.
author: Isha Upanishad

quote: The self that is subtler than the subtle and greater than the great is seated in the heart of every creature. One who is free from desire sees the glory of the self through the tranquillity of the mind and senses and becomes absolved from grief.
author: Katha Upanishad

quote: This Atman, resplendent and pure, whom the sinless sannyasins behold residing within the body, is attained by the unceasing practice of truthfulness, austerity, right knowledge, and continence.
author: Mundaka Upanishad

quote: To the seer, all things have verily become the Self: what delusion, what sorrow, can there be for him who beholds that oneness?
author: Isha Upanishad

quote: Dissolves the self in the supreme self as the pot-space is dissolved in infinite space; then, as the infinite be silent forever, O sage!
author: Adhyatma Upanishad

quote: Knowing that great and all-pervading self by which one sees (the objects) both in the sleep and the waking states, the intelligent man grieves no more.
author: Katha Upanishad

quote: Liberated from the grip of egoism, like the moon (after the eclipse), full, ever blissful, self-luminous, one attains one’s essence.
author: Adhyatma Upanishad

quote: Fools, dwelling in darkness, but wise in their own conceit and puffed up with vain scholarship, wander about, being afflicted by many ills, like blind men led by the blind.
author: Mundaka Upanishad

quote: He who perceives all beings in the self alone, and the self in all beings, does not entertain any hatred on account of that perception.
author: Ishavasya Upanishad

quote: That which is consciousness alone which is all-pervading, which is eternal, which is all-full, which is of the form of bliss and which is indestructible, is the only true Brahman (infinite consciousness).
author: Varaha Upanishad

quote: Bondage is the imagination prompted by the desire for the eight powers.
author: Niralamba Upanishad

quote: Whether the body perishes now or lasts the age of moon and stars, what matters it to me having consciousness alone as my body? What matters it to the sky in the pot, whether it (the pot) is destroyed now or exists for a long time.
author: Varaha Upanishad

quote: Like the butter hidden in milk, the pure consciousness resides in every being. That ought to be constantly churned out by the churning rod of the mind.
author: Amrita-bindu Upanishad

quote: Man is bound by ‘mine’, but he is released by ‘not mine’. He should abandon all the thoughts relating to externals and so also with references to internals. O Ribhu, having given up all thoughts, you should rest content (in your soul) ever.
author: Varaha Upanishad

quote: In order to realize the self, renounce everything. Having cast off all (objects), assimilate yourself to that which remains.
author: Annapurna Upanishad

quote: Being first in a state of changelessness and then thoroughly forgetting (even) that state owing to the cognition of the (true) nature of Brahman (infinite consciousness) – this is called samadhi.
author: Tejo-bindu Upanishad

quote: When all longings that are in the heart vanish, then a mortal becomes immortal and attains Brahman (infinite consciousness) here.
author: Katha Upanishad

quote: Those who are clever in arguments about Brahman, but are without the action pertaining to Brahman (infinite consciousness) and who are greatly attached to the world – those certainly are born again and again (in this world) through their ajnana (ignorance).
author: Tejo-bindu Upanishad

quote: Arise! Awake! Approach the great and learn. Like the sharp edge of a razor is that path, so the wise say—hard to tread and difficult to cross.
author: Katha Upanishad

quote: As rivers, flowing down, become indistinguishable on reaching the sea by giving up their names and forms, so also the illumined soul, having become freed from name and form, reaches the self-effulgent supreme self.
author: Mundaka Upanishad

quote: That which cannot be expressed by speech, but by which speech is expressed. That alone know as Brahman and not that which people here worship.
author: Kena Upanishad

quote: That which cannot be apprehended by the mind, but by which, they say, the mind is apprehended. That alone know as Brahman and not that which people here worship.
author: Kena Upanishad

quote: That which cannot be perceived by the eye, but by which the eye is perceived. That alone know as Brahman and not that which people here worship.
author: Kena Upanishad

quote: Children, immersed in ignorance in various ways, flatter themselves, saying: we have accomplished life’s purpose. Because these performers of karma do not know the truth owing to their attachment, they fall from heaven, misery—stricken, when the fruit of their work is exhausted.
author: Mundaka Upanishad

quote: Where do the gods fit in this creation scheme? Who knows for certain? Who shall here declare it? Whence was it born, whence came creation? The gods are later than this world’s formation; Who then can know the origins of the world? None knows whence creation arose; And whether he has or has not made it; He who surveys it from the lofty skies. Only he knows- or perhaps he knows not.
author: Rigveda

quote: Truth is one, but the wise men know it as many; God is one, but we can approach Him in many ways.
author: Rigveda

quote: One should eat nutritious food and exercise regularly to have sound health. Virtuous deeds performed with intelligence shall naturally bring good wealth.
author: Rigveda

quote: Praises make the wicked deaf (they can’t tolerate criticism) while people who praise become successful because of their humility.
author: Rigveda

quote: Ego is the biggest enemy of humans.
author: Rigveda

quote: From it the horses were born and all that have cutting teeth in both jaws. The cows were born from it, also. From it were born goats and sheep.
author: Rigveda

quote: The person, who imparts knowledge also gives numerous added advantages.
author: Rigveda

quote: To what is One, sages give many a title they call it Agni, Yama, Mātariśvan.
author: Rigveda

quote: May there be unison in the speech and action of humans. Only by this shall, unity emerge and serve each other purpose. The nation shall emerge stronger and mightier because of this.
author: Rigveda

quote: Laziness begets nothing but failure and lost opportunities.
author: Rigveda

quote: One should never fear sorrow because it is the stepping stone to happiness.
author: Rigveda

quote: One should always ensure a pure environment while making food. One should never prepare food with dirty hands. This could lead to a number of ailments and make the body weak.
author: Rigveda

quote: One should strongly resent miserliness and indulge in charity because one can acquire the never-ending wealth of immortality by doing so.
author: Rigveda

quote: People who are proud do not adhere or acquire anything and as a result of which the ego gets destroyed.
author: Rigveda

quote: Only by attaining knowledge can one become free from ignorance and eliminate his sins. Such a man dwells independently as his mind become free from fear.
author: Rigveda

quote: Lack of faith, treachery, arguments and animosity only breed malevolence. It is in the best interest of all to avoid this tread on the path of progress.
author: Rigveda

quote: It is important for a person to remain healthy and sound because a healthy mind dwells in a healthy body.
author: Rigveda

quote: Without knowledge a man is no better than an animal.
author: Rigveda

quote: Even God blesses only those who are contemplative, intelligent and the protectors of the weak.
author: Rigveda

quote: Darkness was hidden by darkness in the beginning. All this was an indistinguishable sea. That which becomes, that which was enveloped by the void, that alone was born through the power of heat.
author: Rigveda

quote: The non-existent was not; the existent was not at that time. The atmosphere was not, nor the heavens which are beyond. What was concealed? Where? In whose protection? Was it water? An unfathomable abyss?
author: Rigveda

quote: Intelligence is the mightiest and nothing is beyond its reach.
author: Rigveda

quote: By practicing concentration the mind can be made stable. A stable mind helps in taking right decisions and achieving the desired result.
author: Rigveda

quote: The mind is fickle like a fast galloping horse and the only way to control him is by involving him in good actions beneficial for the welfare of all. The person who does so shall achieve success and peace.
author: Rigveda

quote: The first form of happiness is sound health, one should partake nutritious, balanced food to keep the body healthy. So it is essential to maintain the health of the mind and body simultaneously.
author: Rigveda

quote: In real worship, we just not do ritualistic worship but we try to imbibe the qualities of the one we are worshipping.
author: Rigveda

quote: Just as the Sun is respected for providing heat and energy to the world, in the same manner you too can attain respect in this world by acquiring knowledge.
author: Rigveda

quote: Knowledge brings power.
author: Rigveda

quote: Play not with dice, cultivate your corn-land. Enjoy the gain, and deem that wealth sufficient.
author: Rigveda

quote: In the beginning There was neither existence nor nonexistence, Neither sky nor heaven beyond … That One breathed, without breath, By his own breathless power. The first born was the Creative Will, The primordial seed of the mind. All else followed. The sages, searching for the truth within themselves, Discovered the eternal bond between the seen and unseen. This bond was an endless line stretched across the heavens. What was above? What was below? Primal seeds were sprouting, mighty forces were moving; Pulsation from below, pure energy above. Who here knows? Who can say for sure? When it began and from where it came-this creation? The gods came afterwards So who really knows? From where this creation came, By what means it was formed, Only He who watches from the highest heaven knows or perhaps even He does not know!
author: Rigveda

quote: May the earth be peaceful, May the atmosphere be peaceful, May the medicinal herbs be peaceful May all shining objects be peaceful, May all the enlightened persons be peaceful May all the actions be peaceful. By these peace May we alleviate that which is terrific here That which is cruel here, That which is sin here, That has been calmed, that is auspicious. Let all be gracious unto us.
author: Atharvaveda AV 19-9-14

quote: May we see a hundred autumns May we live a hundred autumns May we acquire knowledge up to a hundred autumns May we go on advancing forward to a hundred autumns May we thrive a hundred autumns May we exist for a hundred autumns May we remain pure a hundred autumns And let us remain even more than a hundred autumns
author: Atharvaveda AV 19-67

quote: May our mother-father (parents) live happily, well be it with the cows, men and all the world, many happy fortune, grave and favour ever accompany us and may we enjoy sun light for a very long period
author: Atharvaveda AV 1-31-4

quote: One hundred fortunes have born all together with the birth of the body of the mortal (man) (upon which he has right by birth) of those we cast away those which leads us to sinful acts. O God, the knower of entire creation please let us have those fortunes which will prove blessings to us
author: Atharvaveda AV 7-115-3

quote: Fame and glory, power and managing capacity, spiritual splendour, nourishment and other means of subsistence belong to him who knows this Divinity as Simple and One
author: Atharvaveda AV 13-4-14-5

quote: May the power of speech remain in my mouth, may the vital air ever exist in my nostrils, may the power of sight ever exist in my eye, may the power of hearing remains in my ears, let not my hair become gray, let not my teeth become dirty and let my arms possess much strength
author: Atharvaveda AV 19-60-1

quote: May I have strength in my thighs, swiftness in my legs and firmness in my feet; may all the organs of my body be healthy and may my soul be ever alert
author: Atharvaveda AV 19-60-2

quote: May all the different parts of my body remain in good condition and may the power of endurance ever exist in me against the enemies. May I attain the full length of life. May I attain the happiness and fullness in all respects and purifying myself, may I attain the state of perfect bliss
author: Atharvaveda AV 19-60-1

quote: May all the constellations, in the absence of sun, the sources of its light! Which are in the heaven, all those in the sky, in the waters, on the earth and on the mountains and in all directions as well as all the regions wherever the moon goes, prove the source of happiness to us.
author: Atharvaveda AV 19-8-1

quote: O mankind! I ordain for you to have concordance in your heart, unanimity in your minds and freedom from hatred. Every one of you ought to love one another in every way just as the cow loves the calf just born
author: Atharvaveda AV 3-30-1

quote: Let the son be obedient to his father and in accordance with the mind of his mother. Let the wife speak to her husband calm, gentle, sweet words as honey
author: Atharvaveda AV 3-30-2

quote: Neither a brother should hate his brother nor a sister unkind to her sister, you ought to speak with another most gently being united in your mind and keeping the same ideal before you
author: Atharvaveda AV 3-30-3

quote: That path of the Vedas I ordain in your home against which the enlightened persons never go nor do they bear hatred towards one another, so that it may serve as leading principle for all men
author: Atharvaveda AV 3-30-4

quote: O Mankind! Who are respectful to the elders possessing noble hearts, friendly, in your undertakings of acquiring wealth and walking in the same path bearing the common yoke together, be never disunited with one another, come, I make you one intentioned and one minded and each one of you speak sweetly to the other
author: Atharvaveda AV 3-30-5

quote: Let your place of drinking water be common and your food be together as I yoke you to a common yoke; worship Agni, all of you together, just as the spokes are attached to the navel of the chariot from all around
author: Atharvaveda AV 3-30-6

quote: O Mankind! I enjoin on all of you to be mutually helping one another, to be united in your mind and to have common ideal of life for benefitting one another. Like the enlightened persons whoever take care of immortal principle (in their life) may the friendly feelings amongst you increase morning and evening
author: Atharvaveda AV 3-30-7

quote: These five senses with the mind as sixth which abide in my heart are made sharp by means of prayer. By which all the awful works are done, may we attain peace by them
author: Atharvaveda AV 19-9-5

quote: O Lord! Make me an object of love among the enlightened persons, and make me beloved among the rulers of the world; Make me dear to all who happen to see me whether they be ordinary labourers or noble persons
author: Atharvaveda AV 19-62-1

quote: O Indra! God of Supreme Power! Make us fearless of all such things whereof we are afraid of
author: Atharvaveda AV 19-15-1

quote: May the atmosphere give us peace and safety and may both these heaven and earth be secure for us. May we be free from danger from west and east and may there be no fear from north and south
author: Atharvaveda AV 19-15-5

quote: May we be fearless of our friends and even of those who are unfriendly to us, may we never fall in dread of those whom we know and even of those we don’t know: May we remain free from any apprehension by night and in the day time, and may all the quarters be friendly to us
author: Atharvaveda AV 19-15-6

quote: My homage to the Almighty God who is the ordainer of all that existed in the past and of that which will exist in the future in the form of eternal bliss
author: Atharvaveda AV 10-8-1

quote: He is the Creator, the Ordainer, the Source of all types of motion and energy. He is the highest feeder
author: Atharvaveda AV 13-4-3

quote: He is called neither the second, nor the third and not yet the fourth also. He is called neither the fifth, nor the sixth and not yet the seventh also. He is called neither the eighth, nor the ninth and not yet the tenth also
author: Atharvaveda AV 13-4-16/18

quote: He takes care of all that breathes and of all that does not breathe. He has got all this conquering power. He is the one and one alone and the only one. All these luminous forces of nature become one in him
author: Atharvaveda AV 13-4-19/21

quote: If a man stands, walks and deceives other person, whether he does these in private chamber or publicly; and whatever two persons sitting together whisper secretly? The Imperial Ruler Varuna knows it all, being present there as the third one amongst them
author: Atharvaveda AV 4/16/2

quote: Even this earth belongs to the Imperial Ruler Varuna and the mighty Sun too, situated at the farthest end in His possession. The two oceans (ocean of earth and atmosphere) are as it the two cavities of his abdomen and he is wholly pervading even this single drop of its water
author: Atharvaveda AV 4/16/3

quote: If one should run away for beyond the heaven, even then he cant get rid of the vigilance of the Imperial Ruler Varuna. Because of his thousand eyed luminous powers of circumspection are ever watchful over this earth
author: Atharvaveda AV 4/16/4

quote: By whom has this earth been made? By whom has the heaven been placed over it? By whom has this expansion of atmosphere been raised upon high and stretched across?
author: Atharvaveda AV 10-2-24

quote: The earth has been made by Brahma – The Supreme Being and it is Brahma again who has placed the heaven above it. It is Brahma by whom has the atmosphere been raised upon high and stretched across
author: Atharvaveda AV 10-2-25

quote: The Supreme Being manifests himself in the innermost chamber of our hearts, all that which move or not move and all living creature have wholly taken shelter in Him
author: Atharvaveda AV 10-8-6

quote: I know the all spreading cord wherein are interwoven all these creatures. I know the cord of the cords, hence I know Supreme God
author: Atharvaveda AV 10-8-38

quote: God the Pillar of support is holding both the earth and the heaven and the pillar of support is holding the vast atmosphere. The Pillar of support is holding the extensive six directions and the Pillar of support is pervading the entire universe
author: Atharvaveda AV 10-7-35

quote: Wherein the earth, the atmosphere and the heaven live, wherein the fire, the moon, the sun and the air have taken shelter; say He is the Pillar of support; verily he is the most Blissful Being
author: Atharvaveda AV 10-7-12

quote: O Myself! The first attack of jealousy together with that which follow the first appearance of it, is the fire which is filled in your heart (source of constant sorrow). I drive away completely the same from your heart
author: Atharvaveda AV 6-18-1

quote: Just as the earth is dead in consciousness yes, it is more dead in consciousness than the dead, just as the spirit of the dead is, similarly the spirit of the jealous man is dead (within himself)
author: Atharvaveda AV 6-18-2

quote: O Myself! That thought which is sheltered in your heart, the low-mindedness which hovers therein. I drive away jealousy from that, just as one drives away hot air from the bellows
author: Atharvaveda AV 6-18-3

quote: May the heaven be peaceful, May the earth be free from disturbance, May the vast atmosphere be calm, May the flowing waters be soothing May all the plants and herbs prove beneficial to us
author: Atharvaveda AV 19-9-1

quote: May all the foretelling signs of coming events be free from turmoil and may all that has been done and that which has not been done prove the source of happiness to all: May past and future be peaceful and may all be gracious unto us
author: Atharvaveda AV 19-9-2

quote: May he is full of splendour, the holy, pervading the sun and averts all the sufferings caused by objects natural laws from us. He is the only one lord, who supports all creatures of the universe. The friendly god is the only one object of worship bless us
author: Atharvaveda AV 2-2-2

quote: Impatience is the enemy of wisdom; it propels us to jump to conclusions, judge and condemn rather than to understand.
author: Shri Ram

quote: When Tadaka interrupted Vishwamitra’s yagna, we called her a demon. Now we plan to interrupt Indrajit’s worship. Are we demons too?
author: Shri Ram

quote: A wise man should foresee tragedy or misfortune and take action to prevent or overcome such tragedy or misfortune well before it strikes. Thus only he can enjoy a safe and good life.
author: Shri Ram

quote: No matter how wise a person like Ravana, even if he is a ten-headed intelligent one, if he is devoid of Dharma, then destruction is certain.
author: Shri Ram

quote: Those who have knowledge of dharma say that truth is the highest dharma.
author: Shri Ram

quote: Never consider your opponent, your enemy smaller than you. What Ravana thought of as ordinary apes and bears destroyed his entire army.
author: Shri Ram

quote: Supporting the unrighteous is also the cause of destruction.
author: Shri Ram

quote: When a man’s destruction comes, his intellect gets corrupted.
author: Shri Ram

quote: Mother and motherland are greater than heaven!
author: Shri Ram

quote: Meaning, many are yes-men who tell you what you want to hear. But rare are those who speak what you must hear and rare are those who listen to good advice.
author: Shri Ram

quote: Dharma (righteousness) is more important than any divine boon.
author: Shri Ram

quote: One who is virtuous and wise, just and merciful, is a true human.
author: Shri Ram

quote: My father's command is my destiny.
author: Shri Ram

quote: A leader should be like a father to his subjects.
author: Shri Ram

quote: The greatness of a king lies in being accessible to the humblest citizen.
author: Shri Ram

quote: In the happiness of his subjects lies the king's happiness; in their welfare his welfare.
author: Shri Ram

quote: Your devotion is my strength.
author: Shri Ram

quote: In the garden of thy heart, plant nought but the rose of love.
author: Shri Ram

quote: No one can change the direction of the wind, but one can adjust the sails to reach the destination.
author: Shri Ram

quote: Self-control is the warrior's true strength.
author: Shri Ram

quote: Just as people are afraid of serpents they are afraid of people who utter lies. Truth controls this world and dharma is rooted in truth.
author: Shri Ram

quote: There is no deity powerful than time.
author: Shri Ram

quote: Only the timid and the weak leave things to destiny but the strong AND the self-confident never bank on destiny or luck.
author: Shri Ram

quote: You cannot count on the physical proximity of someone you love, all the time. A seed that sprouts at the foot of its parent tree remains stunted until it is transplanted. Rama will be in my care, and he will be quite well. But ultimately, he will leave me too. Every human being, when the time comes, has to depart to seek his fulfilment in his own way.
author: Shri Ram

quote: To be happy always is something which is difficult to achieve. That is to say, happiness and sorrow alternate in one's life and there cannot be uninterrupted happiness alone.
author: Shri Ram

quote: If a person is gifting away his elephant but his heart is set on the rope used for tying the elephant, of what use is his attachment to the rope when he is giving away the elephant itself.
author: Shri Ram

quote: Lord Ram gave Hanuman a quizzical look and said, 'What are you, a monkey or a man?' Hanuman bowed his head reverently, folded his hands and said, 'When I do not know who I am, I serve You and when I do know who I am, You and I are One.'
author: Tulsidas

quote: Lust, anger, vanity and covetousness are all paths leading to hell. Abjuring, all these adore the Hero of Raghu’s line, whom saints worship.
author: Tulsidas

quote: Shri Ram said: 'Ever since I have been separated from you, Sita, everything to me has become its very reverse. The fresh and tender leaves on the trees look like tongues of fire; nights appear as dreadful as the night of final dissolution and the moon scorches like the sun. Beds of lotuses are like so many spears planted on the ground, while rain-clouds pour boiling oil as it were. Those that were friendly before, have now become tormenting; the cool, soft and fragrant breezes are now like the hissing serpent. One’s agony is assuaged to some extent even by speaking of it, but to whom shall I speak about it? For there is no one who will understand. The reality about the chord of love that binds you and me, dear, is known to my heart alone; and my heart ever abides with you. Know this to be the essence of my love.'
author: Tulsidas

quote: When a minister, a physician and a religious preceptor; these three use pleasing words from fear or hope of reward, the result is that dominion, health, and faith, all the three immediately set towards destruction.
author: Tulsidas

quote: That villainous crew- greed, infatuation, jealousy, arrogance, and pride haunts the mind only so long as the Divine does not take up His abode there. Attachment to the world is like a dark night fully advanced, which is so delightful to the owls of attraction and aversion; it abides in the heart of a creature only so long as the sun of the Lord’s glory does not shine there. Having seen Your lotus feet, O Rāma, I am now quite well and my grave fears have been set at rest. The threefold torments of mundane existence cease to have any effect on him who enjoys Your favor, my gracious lord. I am a demon vilest of nature and have never done any good act. Yet the Lord whose beauty even sages fail to perceive with their mindís eye has been pleased to clasp me to His bosom.
author: Tulsidas

quote: Abandon pride, which is the same as Tamas-guna (darkness), rooted as it is in ignorance and is a source of considerable pain; and adore Lord Shri Rama, the Chief of the Raghus and an ocean of compassion. (Page 787).
author: Tulsidas

quote: There can be no happiness for a being nor can its mind know any peace even in a dream so long as it does not relinquish desire, which is an abode of sorrow.
author: Tulsidas

quote: Nothing is unattainable, my Lord, to him who enjoys Your grace. Through Your might, a mere shred of cotton can surely burn a submarine fire (the impossible can be made possible).
author: Tulsidas

quote: Abandon pride, which is the same as Tamas-guna (darkness), rooted as it is in ignorance and is a source of considerable pain; and adore Lord Shri Rama, the Chief of the Raghus and an ocean of compassion.
author: Tulsidas

quote: The divine light shines from within.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Surrender the ego to find the true self.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Silence calms the restless mind.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Detach from desire to know real peace.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Go within to experience the kingdom of God.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Living rightly is its own reward.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: By letting go, we gain all.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Where there is Oneness, there is bliss.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: The wise find contentment in simplicity.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: True wealth lies not in possessions but in awareness.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Be the silent witness and watch the drama of life unfold.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Suffering ceases when we accept what is.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: We shape life by our deepest beliefs.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Surrender to gain freedom.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: See the Divine in all beings and all beings in the Divine.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Detachment grants vision of eternal truth.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Calm the fluctuations of mind to know the Self.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Divinity sleeps within, waiting to be awakened.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: External change comes through inner transformation.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: In silence, endless wisdom arises.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Nothing real is ever threatened, nothing unreal exists. Herein lies peace.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: You alone can walk your path – no one else.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Not getting what you want is sometimes a wonderful stroke of luck.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: What you seek, you already are.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: You have never left God. Only in dreams have you done this.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: There is no sin but unawareness and no redemption but awareness.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Reality cannot be grasped, only realized.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Compassion hidden within emerges when ego dissolves.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Everything you perceive has something to teach you.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Divinity isn’t bestowed, it is recognized.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: In each moment, eternity beholds itself.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Letting go of judgments sets the spirit free.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Blame keeps the focus outward instead of inward.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: If peaceful surrender seems impossible, persist anyway.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Look deeper to see differently.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Equanimity comes when attachment ends.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: There is no storm the sun does not illuminate.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: All things pass. Awareness endures.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Focus not on changing external things, change your inner vision.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Wisdom, patience and trust – walk steadily with these companions.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Darkness ceases with the coming of light. Ignorance flees from awareness.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Progress occurs when we walk the path, not when we reach the destination.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Infinite patience produces immediate results.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: There is no higher truth than one’s direct experience.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Realizing the truth – therein lies liberation.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: You are not the molded, you are the molten gold.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: There is light ahead if you but carry a lantern.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: We liberate ourselves when we release others.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: The witness does not waver.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: We come closest to the Divine by living from the heart.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Only when the pond is still can it reflect the moon.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: You lose yourself on the way to the grocery store. The search for God is far shorter.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Truth is within. Look inward to find what you seek.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: We are one when my truths are your truths.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Staying grounded in change is divine wisdom.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Before enlightenment, chop wood and carry water. After enlightenment, chop wood and carry water.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: You have enough to be grateful for now if you are willing to look.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: The moment measures eternity.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Pain and loss, though difficult, serve a higher purpose.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Focus not on changing external forms, transform inner vision.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Faith moves mountains within, which alters their outer position.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Tolerate all things with good humor.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: A quiet mind perceives a singing universe.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Spirit sees not division between self and other.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: You lose nothing by surrendering suffering.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Your reactions reflect what is within.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: In awareness is found deep and lasting contentment.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Turn within to see dreams dissolve.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: What you give is what you receive.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: True giving exists without thought of reward.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: By surrendering control, real influence arrives.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Come to the fire of truth to be refined.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Your life is now. Past and future only exist in mind.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Today’s faithlessness is just an opportunity for more faith tomorrow.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Meditation is prayer of the heart.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Outward focus binds, inward focus frees.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Follow the wisdom of your soul – not the dictates of society.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Allow the intensity of existence to awaken divine sight.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: In solitude, the real Self quietly emerges.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Expansion requires surrender.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Mind, senses, ego – temporary visitors. Awareness – permanent host.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Mistaking differences for division comes from confused perception.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Peace isn’t the absence of suffering – it is the ability to move through it gracefully.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Do not seek meaning in concepts. Unveil meaninglessness to find truth.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: You are the awareness behind your thoughts and emotions.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: With awakened perception, the mundane becomes divine.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Tolerate everything, attach to nothing.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Who looks outside dreams. Who looks within awakens.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: You shape your world when you shape yourself.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Drama dissolves when you stop believing you are at the center.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Suffering is attention seeking in disguise.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Knowledge speaks. Wisdom listens.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Vanquish prejudices by expanding perspectives.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Awareness breaks bonds to set spirit free.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: No emotion obstructs when wisdom guides.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Perception of separation veils our light. Revealing unity reclaims our brilliance.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: You are brought to the very edge of reality to see most clearly.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Change occurs in the fertile silence after the storm.
author: Lord Shiva

quote: Suffering ceases when attachment ends.
author: Lord Shiva
